result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:53 AM Defendant Roberto Perez Cardoza in court.  Attorney Teri Strohschein for Katherine Marie Findley in court for Roberto Perez Cardoza.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Lesli Monroy appears, sworn. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court accepts waiver; binds over to Br 2; sets Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims, victims' residence, families, or workplace; Defendant shall not go on the premises at Mueller Farms Lomira,WI; The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:47 PM Defendant Roberto Perez Cardoza in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Roberto Perez Cardoza - SPD eligibility tbd.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $300 cash  bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims, victims residences, families, and workplaces. No contact with Mueller Farms Lomira, WI. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
